skill.name: learn-reset
skill.description: Clear the knowledge base and start fresh
skill.summary: Clear the knowledge base and start fresh
skill.author: 0xrdan

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, scripts, network calls, or external commands. It provides instructions for Claude to clear knowledge files within the designated knowledge directory only. All 28 static findings are false positives caused by pattern misidentification: YAML frontmatter and markdown code blocks were incorrectly flagged as weak crypto and shell execution patterns.

content.value_statement: The knowledge base accumulates insights over time which may become outdated or unwanted. This skill provides a controlled way to clear all accumulated learning data and start fresh with a clean slate.
actual_capabilities: Clear patterns, quirks, and decisions from knowledge/learnings/
limitations: Cannot restore data after reset (no backup is created)
Git history may retain previous knowledge if committed
Does not delete the knowledge directory structure itself

use_cases.title: Start fresh exploration
use_cases.description: Clear accumulated context to explore a codebase from scratch with a fresh perspective

use_cases.title: Fix incorrect learnings
use_cases.description: Reset when knowledge base has accumulated incorrect or misleading patterns

use_cases.title: Remove sensitive context
use_cases.description: Clear knowledge that may contain project-specific or confidential information

prompt_templates.title: Basic reset
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the learn-reset skill to clear all accumulated knowledge and reset the learning state

prompt_templates.title: Clear patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Use learn-reset to clear only the patterns.md file while preserving quirks and decisions

prompt_templates.title: Full reset
prompt_templates.prompt: Run learn-reset to perform a complete reset of all knowledge files, cache, and learning state

prompt_templates.title: After cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Confirm that the knowledge base has been reset and summarize what was cleared

output_examples.input: Use learn-reset to clear all knowledge
output: The knowledge base is now empty. Use /learn to start fresh.

output_examples.input: Run learn-reset to start fresh on this project
output: All knowledge files have been reset to their initial state.
The knowledge directory structure is preserved.
You can now use /learn to begin accumulating new insights.

output_examples.input: Use the reset skill to clear my accumulated learnings
output: Confirmed: 15 total entries cleared from knowledge base.
Start fresh with /learn command when ready.

best_practices: Always confirm with user before performing destructive reset
Verify all knowledge files have been properly cleared after reset
Inform user about git history implications before proceeding
anti_patterns: Assuming reset affects files outside the knowledge directory

faq.question: Does this skill work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Claude Code and supports the knowledge directory structure used by the learning system.

faq.question: How much data can be reset?
faq.answer: It clears all patterns, quirks, decisions, cached classifications, and learning state counters in the knowledge directory.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other workflows?
faq.answer: This is a standalone skill invoked directly. It modifies only the knowledge directory and does not integrate with external systems.

faq.question: Is my data safe after reset?
faq.answer: The skill does not create backups. Git history may retain previous knowledge if files were committed before reset.

faq.question: What if reset fails?
faq.answer: If reset fails, verify the knowledge directory exists and has proper permissions. Try running the skill again after resolving issues.

faq.question: How is this different from deleting knowledge files?
faq.answer: Reset preserves file structure and restores files to their initial template state rather than deleting files entirely.
